title: Saline Concentration and Red Blood Cell Shape

content.description: Intravenous <math alttext="open parenthesis, I V, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>IV)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> therapy is used for fluid replacement in instances of dehydration in humans and other animals. One type of <math alttext="I V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IV</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> fluid is essentially a saltwater solution. To determine the best concentration for therapy in people, a team of students is researching the effects of solutions of different salt concentrations on red blood cells. The following observations were made from three different red blood cell samples viewed under a microscope.
content.question: <math alttext="0.3 percent" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.3</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Saline (Cells swell) <math alttext="0.9 percent" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.9</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Saline (Cells unchanged) <math alttext="1.5 percent" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Saline (Cells shrink) The team wants to extend the research project. What should the team of students do next to obtain data that are more conclusive?

choices.label: Repeat the process with other salt concentrations.
Develop a model to explain why the cells react differently to different salt concentrations.
Repeat the process using red blood cells from other animals.
Develop an experimental procedure that uses a stain that makes the organelles of red blood cells more visible.

content.answer: Repeat the process with other salt concentrations.

skill.text: 3.D: Propose a new investigation based on an evaluation of the experimental design or evidence.
